Publication-ready table for the parameter estimates

Source: R/bpc_publication.R
get_parameters_table.Rd

Publication-ready table for the parameter estimates

get_parameters_table(
  bpc_object,
  params = NULL,
  format = "latex",
  digits = 3,
  caption = "Parameters estimates",
  HPDI = T,
  n_eff = F
)

Arguments

bpc_object

a bpc object
params

a vector with the parameters to be in the table. If NULL them all will be present
format

A character string. same formats utilized in the knitr::kable function

  • 'latex': output in latex format

  • 'simple': appropriated for the console

  • 'pipe': Pandoc's pipe tables

  • 'html': for html formats

  • 'rst'
digits

number of digits in the table
caption

a string containing the caption of the table
HPDI

a boolean if the intervals should be credible (F) or HPD intervals (T)
n_eff

a boolean. Should the number of effective samples be presented (T) or not (F default).

Value

a formatted table

Examples

# \donttest{
m<-bpc(data = tennis_agresti,
player0 = 'player0',
player1 = 'player1',
result_column = 'y',
model_type = 'bt',
solve_ties = 'none')

#> 
#> SAMPLING FOR MODEL 'bt' NOW (CHAIN 1).
#> Chain 1: 
#> Chain 1: Gradient evaluation took 7.2e-05 seconds
#> Chain 1: 1000 transitions using 10 leapfrog steps per transition would take 0.72 seconds.
#> Chain 1: Adjust your expectations accordingly!

#> Chain 4:                1.25807 seconds (Total)

t<-get_parameters_table(m)
print(t)

#> \begin{table}
#> 
#> \caption{Parameters estimates}
#> \centering
#> \begin{tabular}[t]{lrrr}
#> \toprule
#> Parameter & Mean & HPD\_lower & HPD\_higher\\
#> \midrule
#> lambda[Seles] & 0.504 & -2.385 & 3.405\\
#> lambda[Graf] & 0.949 & -1.864 & 3.725\\
#> lambda[Sabatini] & -0.320 & -3.204 & 2.333\\
#> lambda[Navratilova] & 0.033 & -2.944 & 2.837\\
#> lambda[Sanchez] & -1.095 & -4.042 & 1.708\\
#> \bottomrule
#> \end{tabular}
#> \end{table}
# }
